titleStmt.title: To JOSEPH ELLIS,Joseph Ellis the younger (1815-91); manager of the Bedford Hotel, Brighton, 1845-65. Became leading spirit in the Brighton Literary Society and published two vols of poetry, 1869 and 1876. See N.C. Peyrouton, "When the Wine Merchant Wrote to Dickens: The Dickens-Ellis Correspondence", Dickensian 57 (1961): 105-11. [12] DECEMBER 1868

dateline.placeName: Kennedy’s Hotel, EdinburghCD was in Scotland, 5-19 Dec, as part of the Farewell series of readings.

body.p: I am reading in Scotland, and your letter of the fifth has just now found me here. The bookNot identified; for his gift of a volume of poems (Meletae, 1869), see Pilgrim Letters 12, p. 363 & n. has not come with it, but I have no doubt it awaits me at home. I thank you for it beforehand, and beg to assure you that your second terrible “threat” cannot too soon be carried into execution.Not identified; possibly the sending of Meletae.
